channel.title: ExcludeNodes support
channel.description:
I want to exclude nodes from certain countries.
Does Whonix support **ExcludeNodes** option? If so, the place I need to add this is in **/etc/tor/torrc** in Gateway like how I setup bridges?

item.title: ExcludeNodes support
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Areij:

Is it safe to ignore this?

Yes. ( https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Controller#Arm_FAQ )

Read full topic

item.title: ExcludeNodes support
item.dc:creator: Areij
item.description:
I noticed after adding ExcludeNodes to Tor config. One warning line appears in Arm.

[ARM_WARN] The torrc differs from what torâ€™s using. You can issue a
sighup to reload the torrc values by pressing x.
- torrc value differs on line: 17

  • configuration values are missing from the torrc: HiddenServiceStatistics,
    RunAsDaemon

Is it safe to ignore this?

My config file

DisableNetwork 0

StrictNodes 1
ExcludeNodes {au}, {ca}, {nz}, {gb}, {us}

UseBridges 1
ClientTransportPlugin obfs2,obfs3 exec /usr/bin/obfsproxy managed
ClientTransportPlugin obfs4 exec /usr/bin/obfs4proxy managed

bridge obfs4 /snipped/
bridge obfs4 /snipped/

Read full topic

item.title: ExcludeNodes support
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Areij:

Does Whonix support ExcludeNodes option?

Yes. Same as with system Tor. (Same as with the deb.torproject.org Tor deb package.)

Areij:

If so, the place I need to add this is in /etc/tor/torrc in Gateway like how I setup bridges?

Yes.

Read full topic
